clinical_study.brief_title: Intensive Therapies in Children With Hemiplegia
clinical_study.official_title: Modified Constraint Induced Movement Therapy and Bimanual Intensive Therapy in Children With Hemiplegia. Comparative Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a comparative study where two protocols of intensive therapies will be applied to study the improvements in the functional performance of the affected upper limb of children with hemiparesis and check whether to increase their quality of life.

detailed_description.textblock: the intervention protocols combine different doses of intensive therapy, being 80 hours of modified constraint induced movement therapy followed by 20 hours for protocol 1 and protocol 2 would be the application of protocol 1 inverted, with this, the investigators want to compare how both protocols interfere in the function of the affected upper limb of children with different levels of bimanual functional performance.

primary_outcome.measure: bimanual functional performance, "change" is being assessed
primary_outcome.time_frame: 4 assessments will be carried out in the research in 10 weeks
primary_outcome.description: use of the affected upper extremity of spontaneous character during bimanual activities. It is used the AHA assessment to measure it.

secondary_outcome.measure: quality of life ,"change" is being assessed
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 assessments will be carried out in the research in 10 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: This measure will be assessed with the pedsQL questionnaire

arm_group.description: Protocol 1 will be the intervention administered with 80 h modified constraint induced movement therapy and 20 h bimanual intensive therapy
Protocol 2 will be the intervention administered with 80h bimanual intensive therapy and 20h modified constraint induced movement therapy
Protocol 1 will be the intervention administered with 80 h modified constraint induced movement therapy and 20 h bimanual intensive therapy
Protocol 2 will be the intervention administered with 80h bimanual intensive therapy and 20h modified constraint induced movement therapy

intervention.description: The therapies applied in both protocols are intensive therapies that allow the execution of unimanual activities or bimanual activities with the affected upper limb with different doses. the protocols were carried out at home through the family

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children diagnosed with Unilateral Infantile Cerebral Palsy, Congenital Infantile Hemiparesis.
- Ages between 5 to 10 years.
- Levels of I-III within the , manual ability classification system, MACS.
- Levels of I-III within the gross motor function classification system, GMFCS
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diseases not associated with infantile hemiparesis.
- Low cognitive level to understand the execution of activities.
- Surgeries of the upper extremity during the 6 months prior to the intervention.
- Structured contractures in the affected upper extremity that cause functional impotence.
- Botulinum toxin two months prior to the intervention and application of it during the treatment.
- Epilepsy not controlled pharmacologically
